document.docAuthor: Pesic, Vladimir, Jabaleh, Isa, Saboori, Alireza, Askarianzadeh, Alireza & Asadi, Mahdieh
document.docTitle: Atractides hyrcaniensis Pesic, Jabaleh & Saboori, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new water mite species (Acari: Hydrachnidia) from Golestan Province (NE Iran)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new water mite species (Acari: Hydrachnidia) from Golestan Province (NE Iran)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Holotype (male) dissected and slide mounted in Hoyer's fluid ( MNHP ). Iran , Golestan Province, Sorkhankalate, ca. 15 km E from Gorgan,
vii. 2008
. Paratypes : one male, one female, same collecting site and data as holotype , dissected and slide mounted in Hoyer's fluid.

Additional material . Golestan Province: Jeline Bala city, Garmab Dasht River near Pole Ordogah village, 36 º 47 ΄ 9.1 ʺ N, 54 º 34 ΄ 55.29 ʺ E, 465 m asl.,
03.viii. 2008
( 1 /0/0); Fazel Abad city, Sarmo River near Mohamad Abad village, 36 º 49 ΄ 47.6 ʺ N, 54 º 47 ΄ 35.35 ʺ E, 500 m asl.,
06.viii. 2008
( 1 /0/0); Zarin Gol River near Shirin Abad village, 36 º 47 ΄ 56.2 ʺ N, 55 º 0 1 ΄ 0 4.16 ʺ E, 1945 m asl.,
18 .viii. 2008
( 2 / 3 /0).

Diagnosis . Dorsal integument lineated; dorsal muscle attachment plates unsclerotized. I-Leg- 5 longish, S- 1 and S- 2 narrow interspace ( 14–17 μm in male,> 20 μm in female); I-Leg- 6 relatively short (ratio I-Leg- 5 / 6 < 1.5 ), sausage-shaped; genital field: Ac in an obtuse triangle; excretory pore smooth; Vgl- 1 fused to Vgl- 2 in males (this character is unstable), separate in females; palp: strong sexual dimorphism.

I-Leg (
Fig. 7
): I-Leg- 5 longish, S- 1 and S- 2 narrow interspace; I-Leg- 6 relatively short, sausage-shaped (only slightly thickened basally); I-Leg- 5 dL 144–152 ( 147 ), vL 97–100 ( 99 ), dL/vL 1.49–1.52 ( 1.49 ), HB 45–49 ( 46 ), dL/HB 3.1–3.2 ( 3.2 ), S- 1 L 72–74 ( 73 ), L/
W 9.5
–10.9 ( 9.6 ), S- 2 L 68–70 ( 64 ), L/
W 5.8
–6.1 ( 5.8 ), distance of sword setae at I-Leg-
5 14–15
( 16–17 ), L S- 1 / 2 1.03–1.09 ( 1.14 ); I-Leg- 6 L 103–112 ( 108–110 ), HB 21 ( 19–20 ), L/HB 4.9–5.5 ( 5.5–5.8 ); L I-Leg- 5 / 6 1.35–1.4 ( 1.34 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6–9 .
Atractides hyrcaniensis
sp. nov .
(6–8 = male, 9 = female): 6 = idiosoma, ventral view; 7 = I-Leg-5 and - 6; 8–9 = palp, medial view. Scale bars = 100 μm.

FIGURES 10–11 .
Atractides hyrcaniensis
sp. nov .
, female: 10 = I-Leg-5 and -6; 11 = genital field. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion . With its combination of a lineated dorsal integument, genital field with relatively small acetabula (diameter < 45 μm), a strong sexual dimorphism of P- 2 , a narrow S- 1 and S- 2 interspace and thickened I-Leg- 6 (I-Leg- 6 L/HB <6.0 in male, < 6.5 in female),
Atractides hyrcaniensis
sp. nov .
is similar to
A. fonticolus (
Viets, 1920
)
(Western Palaearctic). It differs from
A. fonticolus
(in parentheses data taken from Gerecke 2003 ) in the more distant S- 1 and - 2 ( 12 μm in male, 13 μm in female), in more slender S- 2 of I-Leg- 5 ( 3.9 in male, 4.3 in female), in distinctly shorter I-Leg- 5 and consequently a lower L ratio I-Leg- 5 / 6 of < 1.5 (ratio I-Leg- 5 / 6 > 1.6 ).
A. hyrcaniensis
sp. nov .
should be considered a rheophilous species, possibly with a tendency to colonize higher order stream sectors, while
A. fonticolus
is crenobiont or at least crenophilous (Gerecke 2003 ).
Etymology. The species is named after ancient Hyrcania (lands south of the Caspian Sea - "Land of the Wolves")
